titles.title: A joint resolution ensuring that the compensation and other emoluments attached to the office of Secretary of the Interior are those which were in effect on January 1, 2005.

vote.text: Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Towns moved to suspend the rules and pass the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S.J. Res. 3.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

term.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

bill.summary: 1/16/2009--Public Law. Declares that the compensation and other emoluments attached to the office of the Secretary of the Interior shall be those that were in effect on January 1, 2005. Sets forth requirements for permitting civil actions and appeals concerning the constitutionality of the appointment and continuance in office of the Secretary of the Interior.
